alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dunn; Pepin (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 8:14PM CDT until April 19 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Chippewa River at Durand affecting Buffalo, Dunn and Pepin Counties. For the Chippewa River...including Eau Claire, Fall Creek, Durand... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chippewa River at Durand. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, The basements of businesses along the river begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 800 AM CDT Saturday, the stage was 13.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM CDT Saturday was 13.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Monday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.9 feet on 05/15/2014. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Chippewa River Durand 13.0 13.5 Sat 8 am CDT 12.2 11.1 10.8 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
